TopicTitle: Is KSP your most played game?

Articles.Content: over the last few months of playing KSP i have also played Minecraft, Skyrim, Railroad tycoon, X Com APoc, Tropico 4, Faster Than Light and Universe sandbox. But over those months of switching games over and over again at a whim, KSP has been one i have consistently played. KSP rocks. (139 hours according to steam)
KSP is my only game. Not easy to find great games in Linux.
I don't have KSP on steam, so I don't know the exact hours. I'm sure it's up there, but I think the top would either be Sim Ant, Pacific Fighters, or Civilization 4.

KSP is defiantly my most played game currently, and pretty much has since I got it last September. However it is not my most played game ever. It is difficult to pin down exactly what game is but I used to play Jurassic Park: Operation Genesis religiously when I was a Kid. I still have it and play it occasionally. I am sure I have put hundreds of hours into Pokemon games, as well as Star wars: Empire At War. I am reasonably confident I have played those games more than KSP.
Skyrim is definitely most played but, Kerbal is quickly becoming the most.

Roblox is first with estimated lets see.

over 3k-5k hours.

KSP is 2nd with only like 500 hours

1. Portal 2 (194 hours)

2. Just Cause 2 (174 hours)

3. Kerbal Space Program (121 hours played)

Though I only switched over to steam KSP about a month ago so I would estimate about 500 hours total
I have no idea how long I've spent, but I've been playing for just under two years. That should be at least 500 hours, probably more. It's my most played game by far.
Minecraft, STO then this

Not by a long shot. I don't have the exact statistics since the games aren't on Steam, but I have several games that I have played for much longer than KSP, simply because I've owned them for many years and keep coming back to them.

Nowhere near it, though I only discovered this game a month ago. It'll probably be up in the top 5 by the time I get bored of it....and that's a lot of hours for someone who has children and has been playing games for 20 odd years.

As I posted elsewhere, my previous record holder was Morrowind, which I played just about every day for 10 months. In a few days, I will have been playing KSP just about every day for a full year. As a rough estimate, that would be somewhere around 1200 hours. And I'm not tired of it yet.
I think I play chivalry a bit more, but I definitly spend more time on ksp (thinking about it , making plans and forum).
IIRC, I have logged in around 150 hours playing KSP. I haven't kept track, but it's the only game I am currently playing at this point in time/.
Planning to get the Steam KSP soon, but I spent a few nights without sleeping while playing it during some weeks.

How are we determining "played", anyway?

In one sense, Kerbal is my "most played" game today. I've had it running for about 23 hours straight now.

In another, it's not the "most played", as I've been playing other games, and haven't touched that computer in almost 23 hours.
I don't have any time played stats as I'm not using steam, but KSP is definitely my most played game since I bought it in November by many magnitudes of time.

How are we determining "played", anyway?

In one sense, Kerbal is my "most played" game today. I've had it running for about 23 hours straight now.

In another, it's not the "most played", as I've been playing other games, and haven't touched that computer in almost 23 hours.

How many hours you actually played it compared to other games. Could be recently or w/e, doesn't matter.

Edited May 28, 2013 by Stealth2668

Actually, not quite. I have 1000+ Hours on Bf2. and about 100 On KSP.

It ranks second, but if i had it before BF2 it might be first.
I have 551 hours on Empire: Total War, but I have been known to often leave it running when sleeping or at work. Kerbal has 214 hours, and those are mostly all actually sitting there, playing.
hmmm...i'm gonna say KSP.

I don't know if I'll ever beat the time I've invested in Ultima IV or Total Annihilation, and don't get me started on Eve Online.

-Lego

460 hours played on Steam.

Let me go empty my bucket.

I can't even begin to guess how many hours I've put into KSP now... Far more than I ever put into any other indie game (and that's saying something, given how much I used to love Dwarf Fortress). I'm certain it's surpassed any of my Steam library's playtime, even Skyrim's intimidating 245 hour clocking. Probably has a ways to go before it can best my all-time most-played game, Star Ocean 2 (which currently is sitting pretty at around 560 hours across 19(!) play-throughs). But I have a feeling it will, in the end.

EDIT: I may well stand corrected. I got KSP first 576 days ago, and I'm fairly certain I've averaged at least an hour a day playing KSP since. Jeez, was 0.11.1 really that long ago?

Edited May 28, 2013 by SkyRender
BF3 has the crown right now, but I haven't touched it since I started playing with making plugins for KSP. KSP is sooooo addictive, its a little scary
